TITLE: Mr.
NAME: Khaled Mohamed Hammouda
ADDRESS: 151 Mohamed Farid Str. , City Center , Cairo
MEMBER_POS: Head of Mid Cap, SMEs, Microfinance Group
Company Bio:
Banque Misr was established in 1920 by the pioneer economist Mohamed Talaat Harb Pasha, who came up with the concept of investing national saving and directing them towards economic and social development and thus Banque Misr became the first bank to be wholly owned by Egyptians.
Since 1920, Banque Misr has been concerned with the establishment of companies in various fields, including spinning and weaving, insurance, transportation, aviation and cinema, and has continued to support all its activities at a steady rate, Banque Misr currently owns equity in 220 projects including financial, industrial, tourism, housing, Agri and food, general service, in addition to projects in the field of communication and information.
Banque Misr has also established major investment funds in Egypt as a part of a diversified portfolio, and has been granted an award by the Global Finance Treasury and Cash Management Awards, as the 'Best Provider of Money Market Funds in Middle East for the year 2008 and 2012' and 'Best Provider of Money Market Funds in Africa and the Middle East for the year 2009 and 2010.
Banque Misr was the first and only Egyptian bank on the list amongst the top leading arrangers for syndicated loans, as the bank has shared a lead position in Q1/2012, as the best arranger of project loans in Europe, Middle East and north Africa. Also, Banque Misr has maintained its outstanding performance, ranked the second amongst banks managing and marketing syndicated loans in the Middle East and north Africa, same period.
A true pioneer in the region, Banque Misr became the first bank in Egypt and North Africa to become compliant with PCI data security standards, upon obtaining the global Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 1.2.1 (PCI DSS 1.2.1) certification. Utilizing the latest technology in the banking sector, Banque Misr is constantly looking to expand customer access to banking services. Today, Banque Misr is proud to offer one of Egypt's largest ATM networks
Company Address: 153 Mohamed Farid Str. Banque Misr Tower 24th Floor , City Center , Cairo

TITLE: Eng.

ADDRESS: 7 Abdel Khalek Tharwat Str. , City Center , Cairo
Company Bio:
In the current phase, construction, building and contracting sector is playing a major economic role as one of the principal basis of development due to its effective contribution in infrastructure completion such as utilities and housing.
Construction and building sector has an important economic influence. It affects more than 90 industries such as cement, iron, plaster, painting, ceramics and wooden industries...etc. This sector is also considered one of major sectors that attracts manpower. About 8% of total manpower in Egypt is working in this field.
The Holding company for construction and development (Egyptian holding stock co.),working under law 203 of year 1991, is considered one of the biggest companies in the field of construction and building in Egypt.  Hccd started its activities since 1960 under different names according to the legal regulations controlling its frame of work. Finally, it ended as one of Ministry of public enterprises companies to adequate the new economic policy that depends on the market mechanism,  the quality assurance and the qualified competition.
Hccd has 20 companies categorized as follows : 9 contracting companies, 1 Foundation company, 1 company for Designs and Engineering consultations, 3 housing companies, 2 electric companies, 3 Irrigation and Drainage companies, 1 company for Agriculture projects management, in addition the company  received  4 companies that returned to the State after Judicial rulings, these companies  followed the National company for Construction& Development  : Omar Effendi, Al-Arabia Company for Foreign Trade, United Company for Trade and Nile Cotton Ginning Company , this after selling 10 companies (6 contracting companies + 2 housing companies + 2 electric contracting companies). The total activity revenue during the fiscal year 2012/2013 is 6287 million pound, which realized a surplus of 416.958 million pound, recording 6.6% of the activity revenue.

TITLE: Mr.
NAME: Sherif Hosny Mohamed El Khadrawy
ADDRESS: 56A Gameat Eldowal Alarabia Str. , Mohandeseen , Giza
MEMBER_POS: Associate of G.M Corporate Banking & Syndicated Loans Group
Company Bio:
Banque Misr was established in 1920 by the pioneer economist Mohamed Talaat Harb Pasha, who came up with the concept of investing national saving and directing them towards economic and social development and thus Banque Misr became the first bank to be wholly owned by Egyptians.
Since 1920, Banque Misr has been concerned with the establishment of companies in various fields, including spinning and weaving, insurance, transportation, aviation and cinema, and has continued to support all its activities at a steady rate, Banque Misr currently owns equity in 220 projects including financial, industrial, tourism, housing, Agri and food, general service, in addition to projects in the field of communication and information.
Banque Misr has also established major investment funds in Egypt as a part of a diversified portfolio, and has been granted an award by the Global Finance Treasury and Cash Management Awards, as the 'Best Provider of Money Market Funds in Middle East for the year 2008 and 2012' and 'Best Provider of Money Market Funds in Africa and the Middle East for the year 2009 and 2010.
Banque Misr was the first and only Egyptian bank on the list amongst the top leading arrangers for syndicated loans, as the bank has shared a lead position in Q1/2012, as the best arranger of project loans in Europe, Middle East and north Africa. Also, Banque Misr has maintained its outstanding performance, ranked the second amongst banks managing and marketing syndicated loans in the Middle East and north Africa, same period.
A true pioneer in the region, Banque Misr became the first bank in Egypt and North Africa to become compliant with PCI data security standards, upon obtaining the global Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 1.2.1 (PCI DSS 1.2.1) certification. Utilizing the latest technology in the banking sector, Banque Misr is constantly looking to expand customer access to banking services. Today, Banque Misr is proud to offer one of Egypt's largest ATM networks
Company Address: 153 Mohamed Farid Str. Banque Misr Tower 24th Floor , City Center , Cairo

TITLE: Mr.
NAME: Tamer Mahmoud Sadek
ADDRESS: 153 Mohamed Farid Str. Banque Misr Tower 24th Floor , City Center , Cairo
MEMBER_POS: General Manager - Group Head - Marketing Support and Business Development Department
Company Bio:
Banque Misr was established in 1920 by the pioneer economist Mohamed Talaat Harb Pasha, who came up with the concept of investing national saving and directing them towards economic and social development and thus Banque Misr became the first bank to be wholly owned by Egyptians.
Since 1920, Banque Misr has been concerned with the establishment of companies in various fields, including spinning and weaving, insurance, transportation, aviation and cinema, and has continued to support all its activities at a steady rate, Banque Misr currently owns equity in 220 projects including financial, industrial, tourism, housing, Agri and food, general service, in addition to projects in the field of communication and information.
Banque Misr has also established major investment funds in Egypt as a part of a diversified portfolio, and has been granted an award by the Global Finance Treasury and Cash Management Awards, as the 'Best Provider of Money Market Funds in Middle East for the year 2008 and 2012' and 'Best Provider of Money Market Funds in Africa and the Middle East for the year 2009 and 2010.
Banque Misr was the first and only Egyptian bank on the list amongst the top leading arrangers for syndicated loans, as the bank has shared a lead position in Q1/2012, as the best arranger of project loans in Europe, Middle East and north Africa. Also, Banque Misr has maintained its outstanding performance, ranked the second amongst banks managing and marketing syndicated loans in the Middle East and north Africa, same period.
A true pioneer in the region, Banque Misr became the first bank in Egypt and North Africa to become compliant with PCI data security standards, upon obtaining the global Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard 1.2.1 (PCI DSS 1.2.1) certification. Utilizing the latest technology in the banking sector, Banque Misr is constantly looking to expand customer access to banking services. Today, Banque Misr is proud to offer one of Egypt's largest ATM networks
Company Address: 153 Mohamed Farid Str. Banque Misr Tower 24th Floor , City Center , Cairo
Councils: Economic Cooperation with Africa Committee
Committees: Banking & Stock Exchange Committee,Industry & Scientific Research Committee,Transport Committee
